titleStmt.title: W. B. Winslow to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG6979

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
W. D. WINSLOW, President.
J. A. CRAWFORD, Cashier.
Office Southern Bank of Kentucky.
Carrollton, Sep 15 1865
E L Van Winkle Esq., Secretary of State
Dear Sir:

I enclose petition to the Governor on the behalf of Henry Branham for remission of fine -- signed by a number of respectable Citizens of this County -- among whom will be found R W Martinson Judge of our County Court -- The Clerks of the Circuit & County Courts -- The attornies of our bar generally and several of the Jury who tried the Case --
The testimony showed a very near approach if not a clear case of Self defence in law and if Consistent with public policy in such Cases it is hoped the petition may be granted
